Mobius, Outside the Boundaries of the Feral Forest

It was near nightfall as the sounds of an expectant mother in pain rang through the small village of wolves and half breeds. Many were excited for the birth of Aphla Wolf Pack Leader Absolem and his wife Tsubaki, who was a half-breed of a rare wolf and echinda. A large crowd of mobians around the small shack in the middle of village as the cries of Tsubaki rang through the night as the full moon began to rise and several other wolves were lighting the pathway torches.

Three and a half years later...

Tsubaki was sprinting with her child in her arms, running away from the villiage in flames and from the cries of war, hate, and fallen warriors and didn't look back as she escaped from death and fled towards a small local village outside of border of Chun-cun where she was pursued by rival wolves and hid inside an old convent that seemed abandoned, losing her pursuers, but also having her make a tough choice to save her only child... Tsubaki took a small woven basket and a dark robe from the covent, placing her sleeping pup gently inside, and quickly dashed through the silent streets as her pursuers looked for her, but dropped off the basket on the doorstep of an old red fox and sprinted away from Chun-cun, drawing the rival wolves away from the village to make one final stand..

My name is Hyperion the Wolf, but many know me as Hypon. I am a Night-Blood Wolf and this is my story...

Hypon waited outside of a small office in a very large base located off the coast of Emerald Beach on a secluded island, waiting for someone to come and get him as the leader was overlooking his records. Hypon was going to ask why, but he nodded and walked out of the office and saw the sign that pointed to the Training Center and walked towards the right.

At the Training Center

As Hypon walked into the training center, he noticed that it was a small facility, but it had enough equipment to train many. But as Hypon entered the facility, a purple chameleon walked up to him and spoke, "So, you're the new blood?" Hypon then replied, "You could say that, my name is Hypon." The chameleon smirked and said as he lead Hypon to the east part of the room, "Espio. Has Sally told you what we are about to do?" Hypon answered, "No, I didn't even make it into her office and I have no clue about why I was brought in here." Espio then shook his head and spoke, "I better explain then, this is a fear simulation and will test you mentally and physically." Hypon was silent for a moment and wasn't frightened, but he was worried a little bit as he followed Espio to three sliver doors that looked like walk-in freezers and watched as Esipo opened the door to see how bright and deep it was into the wall. Esipo then said bluntly, "Get in." Hypon complied and entered the room and heard it close behind him, the lights going out as well...

Hypon stood in the middle of the room and readied himself as he prepared for anything, but could feel an icy cold chill enter the room. He could feel the temperature drop, but he stood strong and waited for anything that would come his way. However, Hypon then quickly felt something whisper into his ear in a foreign anicent wolf tongue and then felt his body being punched repeatedly as the pain felt real and thrown into a nearby wall until his body sunk to the floor and saw a figure holding something that looked like a dagger and heard the words, "You are pathetic, just like your father..." Hypon then blacked out as he felt the blade enter him...

Later...

Hypon quickly woke up if he woke up from a nightmare in a bed that he didn't remember getting into or even entering the very bedroom he was in until he heard the door open and saw Esipo enter and said with a chuckle, "First day is always the roughest, is it not, Hypon?"

Hypon looked at the small map and then answered back, "She was rattled after the defeat of Eggman, but I figured that she would come back to avenge her master. She will make herself known soon enough and I know you four shall be ready to stop her." Dulcy responded with a small amount of wit, "Five if you are still around to help us." Hypon sat down on a nearby chair and cycled through the messages, waiting around to see if Dulcy had anything else for him to do as she went back to looking at the screens.

Most of the messages were from several freedom fighters from Knothole, but he did see a message or two that was from Frost and placed those through the front before getting up from the chair to make his way to his room in the shrine, wanting to go through all of the letters quickly and start working on a reply for Frost if it was an actual letter that needed an actual reply. His room was a very comfortable suite that had a very great view of the village that he grew up in. He made his way over towards his desk and began to open up his letters, glad that there were a lot of fellow Freedom Fighters were actually missing him but wondered that if it was just Sally just trying to show her appreciation for him helping her with setting up a base in his home country by having some of the fighters write to him.
153.title: There and Back Again

Hypon just answers about the tattoo, letting Frost lead their time

1533.content:
Hypon leaned back in his chair as the screen showed his Ice Wolf girlfriend smiling at him, slightly tired from a decent day, but he enjoyed their time more than some rest he could get later. They had set up their video chat after the month since both were tired of long letters that occasionally got lost in the shuffle or weathered by elements. He did remember to lock his door if they decided to get a bit more personal over the camera, although something in Frost's eye made him double check the lock. She had gotten much more active with him since they made things official, to the point where Hypon had developed an awareness of where the hot spots for couples on base were for special times before he left. Frost seemed like she was excited to share something with him...

"It's good to finally see you face to face Hypon, considering we are as far away as the bases go." Frost smiled as she fixed her camera, fixing small bits of static in the frames as much as she could on her side. She was in her bedroom of her room, with her laptop assumely on her lap as her face was mostly in view except for the frame of her bed behind her, wearing what he assumed was the pink nightgown from much earlier in their relationship. "Although the mountains do not make streaming easier. I do have a bit of a surprise for you..."

Hypon smiled as he thought of a few ideas that Frost could have cooked up, although he wondered why she shifted the laptop to her left side. "It's good to see you too Frost. I'm curious what you mean, considering it wasn't too long since our last letters with our usual updates. What surprise do you have for me?" He felt like she may have wanted to stir him up with maybe some fun over the camera, or that she got a gift for him that might be sent over with the mail and this was her way of getting him excited for it. However, he soon realized what Frost meant when she started to slide up her nightgown to show something brand new to his eyes on her behind.

Right on her left cheek was what looked like a paw tattoo, very close to his hand and colored in with a small "H" in the center of it. Hypon thought back to before he left where Frost had asked him to draw his hand for her, now realizing she had gotten this from that picture. "I got this a week after you left, it feels better now, but I wanted to show you that I meant what I said about making this work between us. In my culture, a tattoo is to show determination to a goal or objective, sort of like that white war paint you saw me wearing a few times. It's permanent, a symbol of commitment that I want this as much as you do, and that we'll make this work as long as possible considering my family."
1533.title: A mark of commitment

Later during the night, Hypon walks the Temple Grounds under the moonlight
15332.content:
Hypon just smirked at the words of the Ice Wolf that he had left behind back in Knothole to help set up an upcoming base in his adoptive homeland that was miles from the ashes of his destroyed village before speaking his mind, "It's a very nice surprise, Frost...I'm gonna have to repay you back when I come back. So how have you been since I've been gone; you haven't begun to crawl up the walls without me there? Been thinking about our plan to face your family in the upcoming future? Hypon just wanted to spend time with Frost, even if he just heard her talk for the whole time they had.

On previous occasions, while he was in Chun-Cun, Hypon had recorded most of the journey for Frost to show she could see the home that he grew up in and basically give her slight updates about the assignment but as a way to keep himself connected to his life at Knothole. With his time in Chun-Cun being an open book, he just wanted to hear Frost's thoughts and just listen to her voice. She was the yin to his yang; the one person who was keeping him sane and focused as he was away from home. That being mentioned, he wasn't the only Freedom Fighter that came to "help" set up the base with him as Sally sent his friend and mentor, Lupe, a well-decorated leader, and fighter/leader of a group known as The Wolf Pack and Bunnie Rabbot, someone that Hypon had small brief encounters with when he was associated with Scourge in the past but finally earned her trust after finding the actual mole that was leaking information to Scourge from inside Knothole Base. Lupe was assigned to help train and teach any new recruits who were transferred there while also helping Dulcy set up certain plans for expansion/emergencies. Bunnie Rabbot was tasked with setting up the base's defenses and trying to find a way to boost the signal, having no so much with the latter than the former. However, Hypon had the mindset that Sally sent other people to keep an eye on him from doing something completely stupid due to being so close by to the people who slaughtered his family and clan but he enjoyed the company as he knew they weren't going to be alone for so long as he got word that a few more members were getting sent over to Chun-Cun Base for a "small time".
15332.title: Strong and Silent like the Mountains

choices: Hypon welcomes a change in topic
Hypon wanted to address Frost's thoughts on her family
153322.content:
Hypon heard a small sigh before she slid her underwear up and moved the camera to her face, not exactly thrilled about what she was chewing on in her mind. "Honestly Hypon, I'm trying to remain positive, but my father isn't the type to be forgiving. We might have to handle the situation in a more... aggressive manner than Sally or you would prefer." Frost slowly rubbed her scar in memory, only to pull away from it once she realized her boyfriend was watching with concern in his eyes. "The last thing I want is to see him again after everything he did, but as we proved, the past has a nasty habit of appearing when you don't want it to. I think when the time comes we will try to be civil... to the best we can considering... if he tries to harm either of us, we should react fairly in turn."

Hypon caught a small flicker of fire in her eyes that hinted of a desire to fight back, yet Frost shook it off and instead extended her claws of her hand to distract herself. "Sally made it clear after you left that if we go on a revenge mission and start a civil war, that our service will end to her and the Freedom Fighters. I can't break the promise I gave King Acorn and her unless there really is no other way to make things right, I don't want to leave her defenceless. Yet I want to see my homeland again, to see my home and birthright." The ice wolf took a breath before returning her gaze to the screen, shaking off a feeling of dread on her mind so she could address Hypon. "I-I just made this more depressing than it needed to be, we should be enjoying our time together for as long as we can and push the difficult stuff away for now."

Frost was surprised by Hypon's gesture
1533221.content:
Hypon nodded to the change of topic and added, "I agreed, Frost, but we both know that this has to be discussed sooner or later between us. This is something we can't bury forever and with me being so close to the gaze of your father; it might come up sooner rather than later." Hypon then took that moment to bring up something that was on his mind when he noticed her gesture to him, "You know that I'm going to have to return that favor of yours with something of my own, Frosty. I might have to pull out my kit of paints once again and see what I can do." Hypon rarely dawned war paint like Frost did, saving it for extremely rare occasions and when he did; it was a sign that he was not going to hold back anymore.

Hypon did want to talk about the plan but hearing Frost's distaste for it was good enough for him to wait for a better time but with him being some close to his clan's sacred lands, he knew that this would be the only time for him to hit two birds with one stone. Hypon wanted answers to why his clan caught the ire of the Frost Wolves or simply a reason for they thought to eliminate an entire clan was the only decision from the source; that being Frost's father. He knew the overall story that was told but part of him felt like there was something more to the story and he had a distaste for secondhand knowledge. He wanted answers and he saw Frost's father as the right person to get those answers. The second reason came from Hypon's task to recover an artifact that rested in the center of a locked chamber in the village temple, in a place that only the Nightblood Champion would be able to reach and if anyone else would dare to enter those halls; they would simply perish by the Spirit Guardians that protect it. This was the best time if any to recover it and get the answers he needed. Hypon was warned by Sally that he should mainly stay inside the walls of the Temple Base or the village unless on a mission to prevent any eyewitness events of him out in the open to keep suspicions low about who he was.

15332211.content:
Frost looked like she was considering the gesture, but shook her head instead, her eyes still curious despite her response. "That sounds nice, but I don't want to impose. This tattoo was just something that was on my mind for a while until I got it for you, it's not necessary to get painted up for me in exchange." She stretched out on the bed for a moment as she considered the last times she saw him with war paint, which were a fight to test each other truly and another time for a ritual that he explained to her was from his tribe in honor of a past event. Frost did consider how Hypon watched her reply, thinking of the future between them, while being sure that it was just them that would hear her next words.

"Besides... if there will be returning any favors, we can think of a list for when you come back. A long list... or maybe somethings we can handle over this feed to make it shorter...?" Frost spoke softly and sultry to her boyfriend in a playful manner to get him to think of ideas and consider their time back together once he was done over there. She had some ideas herself, but she didn't want to go down that path until both of them were both ready and no one would interrupt them to make a very awkward scene like the one time back at the base which made a very embarrassing moment.

153323.content:
Hypon and Frost would talk for hours on end but soon, as night approached on his side of the world; He slowly prepared for bed and wished Frost a good night, going to bed for a short while keeping his computer up just so he would have his photo of him and Frost holding each other close as a way to relax and find peace. Hypon took a short hour nap before waking up and sighing as he put on a set of relaxing clothes for the Chun-Cun Early Spring Night in the mountain temple, walking around the temple as he began to reminisce about the past...

Many years back, Hypon and his adoptive rat father would go to the temple every chance they could to meditate, train, or seek knowledge. He wanted to give Hypon a starting education and didn't want him to end up falling behind like the other children in the village. It was also a gathering place for many of Chun-Cun's events that occurred every other weekend and gave him a chance to interact and meet with the other children in the surrounding villages. Now, the temple might have stayed the same with a small number of changes that occurred over the years, either due to when the world was in danger by the hands of Dark Gaia or by one of the many egg bosses that were under Dr. Eggman.

Hypon stopped near one of the older trees on the temple grounds and placed his hand on the bark to gently feel it before hearing a voice coming from behind him... "Taking a walk in the moonlight, Hypon?" He turned around to see Jian the White Tiger standing behind him with crossed arms which lead to him responding, "I couldn't sleep, Jian. I figured a night walk would help calm my nerves." Jian nodded in understanding before adding, "Well, don't stay up too late. We do have a mission to investigate a nearby disturbance that could possibly be either Conquering Storm or Lady Clove trying to move back into this region." Hypon just sighed before saying, "I won't be long, Jian. Thank you for your concern." He watched as Jian smile and glance at him before entering back into the temple making him wonder if she had other thoughts on her mind while she departed, unsure if she fully knew that he was off the market. Hypon then looked at the tree and rubbed an old marking on the bark before returning to his room that read "The Wolves' Bark." that he had carved many years back...

1533231.content:
Around 6 a.m. in Hypon's Bedroom

Hypon's room in the temple turned Freedom Fighter Base was smaller than his room back in Everfree but he was fine with a smaller room as he knew that there were only a few things he needed to bring to his old home. There was a chest that sat at the edge of the bed that contained his larger weapons that he used on occasions such as the sniper rifle that he used on observation-style or assassination missions, a semi-automatic assault rifle that was made custom for him back when he was a GUN Agent to suit any and all situations that would cross his path, and a pair of pistols that he was the most familiar with as he used back before he joined with the AFF. Outside the case sat a very worn blade that had been in Hypon's possession for some time and the newest item that Hypon had been using; a compound bow that didn't look that impressive but was just as deadly up close in melee than from a distance with a quiver of arrows laying right on top of it.

To the left of the room sat Hypon's desk and where his laptop was usually placed when he was not having a conversation with Frost. His chair is covered up with one of his many jackets while the desk was had a collection of files stacked up about either Chun-Cun, the wolf clans that were nearby in the surrounding areas, or several missions that he was leading from his new spot away from home. Then finally, a small closet and bathroom rested nuzzled up against the right side of the wall. There wasn't much of a place to do his morning meditations in the room but he had the entire temple area to do that when he needed to...

Hypon was already up, dressed, and about after only having a few hours of rest but that was where his mediation came in as he was able to rejuvenate when sleep failed him. Hypon was mediating underneath a blossoming dogwood tree that looked over the village that was nearby, taking in the fresh air and the sights in between moments of relaxation. He waited for Cinder's arrival to let him know that they were all ready for his arrival for the mission's briefing as he was still an hour early than everyone else as the breakfast had not even finished being made as it was the usual morning meeting they had since they had smaller numbers to do these sorts of things...
